titleStmt.title: J. S. Masner et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7423

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlette

We, the undersigned, would respectly request the remission of a fine of $50 inflicted on Charles Griffith by the Lexn City Court, for carrying a concealed deadly weapon We understand Mr Griffith had borrowed the weapon for his protection, contemplating leaving Lexington on a trip the day of his arrest. The costs have been paid by Mr Griffith --

J. S. Masner M. C. L.
J H Rigg
Williard Davis
Jno. L. Clark
James Jeffries
John Berry
B. F Holman
David Brock
C. H. Buford
B W Blincoe
Wickliffe Cooper
Shelby Mann
R. H. Prewitt
John J. Hawes --
Joseph Wingate Mayor
Chas H Wickliffe
R Cox
B F Hibler
W. D. Murphy
J. D. Blincoe
Marshal
T. J. Bush
J B Beck
C Whitelsey

Lexington City Ct
vs
Chas Griffith
$50,
Concealed Weapons
Remitted 13th Dec 1865
